Chair Mix-N-Match

A program that handles 3D geometric chair models and produce a new chair model.

Problem

We were given a set of pre-segmented and labeled 3D chair models. Our goal is to design and implement an automated mix-n-match, part assembly based 3D modeling method plus a learned plausibility scoring scheme to evaluate the quality of the generated 3D model.

Solution

The project includes 3 key components, parser, mixer, and scorer.

Parser

We utilized the PartNet-Symh dataset and repurposed the GRASS decoder to construct and align PartNet parts with Symh info. We used K-means to group parts (namely, different legs and armrests). Then a map of part objects and their respective part centroids for every model is passed to the mixer.

Mixer

The mixer randomly chooses four chair parts from a set. Then, the chair parts are manipulated mostly based on the seat component to compose a pleasing chair. Since the chair parts can be very different from each others, we accomplished some high level algorithmic optimizations that accommodate most of the cases without fine-tuning any specific ones.

Scorer

After a chair model is generated, it gets rendered and snapshotted in three different angles (front, side, top) with shading based on vertices’ Z index (depth colouring). The scoring mechanism used pre-built Resnet18 network by PyTorch, trained in Google Collab. We then retrained the weights on approximately 7000 provided images. SGD is used as optimizer and cross entropy loss as the loss function. We also used a binary classification to find the probability of a chair being “good” or not.

My Roles

I primarily focused on the mixing part of the project. Compositing the parts was a challenge of this project since the part decompositions can vary a lot, some of them can be very surprising. The legs are especially challenging due to some irregularity. They are not always in a set of four legs, some times there can be only two pieces or even one piece. In addition, the seat might not be flat to connect the legs. I developed some algorithms that adapt these cases and solved them heuristically.
